column1: Cortisol level from adrenals should be 10x's higher than peripheral
A multiple of at least 2-3 times the peripheral value is needed
Unilateral asymmetric aldosteone:cortisol values on the affected side of 3-5 times that obtained on the unaffected side are consistent with lateralization
Aldosteone:cortisol ratios that are elevated, but differ by less than twofold between the 2 sides, are more consistent with bilateral adrenal hyperplasia
Kahn SL, Angle JF. Adrenal vein sampling. Techniques in Vascular and Interventional Radiology 2010;13(2):110-25.
